news_header: Lesh, a musician and founding member of the Grateful Dead, passed away surrounded by family, leaving a legacy of music and joy.
news_text: Lesh died on Friday morning, surrounded by his family, as reported by NBC News. He was known for bringing joy to those around him and left behind a legacy of music and love. Growing up in suburban San Francisco, Lesh began his musical journey by making a violin, which he later switched to the trumpet. In 1965, he was invited by his friend Jerry Garcia to join as a bassist in the Grateful Dead, a band that blended rock, jazz, and folk, becoming one of the most influential bands in American history. Lesh also formed a jazz band.
